docs.snippet: A University of Wisconsin football recruit was charged Monday with the sexual assault of a woman in her dorm room on the Madison campus in December....

docs.snippet: Emmanuel Sanders, formerly of the Pittsburgh Steelers, is the fifth high-profile player signed by Denver in this off-season....
docs.lead_paragraph: Emmanuel Sanders, formerly of the Pittsburgh Steelers, is the fifth high-profile player signed by Denver in this off-season.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Denver Broncos sign free agent wide receiver Emmanuel Sanders to a three-year, $15 million contract; other football news noted.

headline.main: Receiver Sanders Joins the Broncos’ Free-Agency Haul
headline.print_headline: Sanders, a Receiver, Joins Denver’s Free-Agency Haul

docs.snippet: Two English players have had life bans extended worldwide for fixing matches in Australia's second-tier Victorian Premier League, soccer's governing body FIFA said Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two English players have had life bans extended worldwide for fixing matches in Australia's second-tier Victorian Premier League, soccer's governing body FIFA said Monday.

headline.main: Two Players Get Worldwide Bans for Australian Match-Fixing
headline.print_headline: Two Players Get Worldwide Bans for Australian Match-Fixing

docs.snippet: Liverpool are calling on football fans from around the world to show their support for the 25th anniversary of the Hillsborough disaster by sending in club scarves....
docs.lead_paragraph: Liverpool are calling on football fans from around the world to show their support for the 25th anniversary of the Hillsborough disaster by sending in club scarves.

headline.main: Liverpool Call for Scarves to Mark Hillsborough Anniversary
headline.print_headline: Liverpool Call for Scarves to Mark Hillsborough Anniversary

docs.snippet: Hull City owner Assem Allam's pledge to change the club's name to Hull Tigers next season suffered a setback on Monday when the Football Association was advised by its membership committee to reject the request....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hull City owner Assem Allam's pledge to change the club's name to Hull Tigers next season suffered a setback on Monday when the Football Association was advised by its membership committee to reject the request.

headline.main: FA Council Recommended to Reject Hull City Name Change
headline.print_headline: FA Council Recommended to Reject Hull City Name Change

docs.snippet: A Brazilian company has created a rival to the official World Cup ball and given it the name Gorduchinha, or Little Chubby, the moniker many Brazilians wanted in the first place....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Brazilian company has created a rival to the official World Cup ball and given it the name Gorduchinha, or Little Chubby, the moniker many Brazilians wanted in the first place.

headline.main: Launch of Little Chubby Kicks Off Battle of the Balls
headline.print_headline: Launch of Little Chubby Kicks Off Battle of the Balls

docs.snippet: The trial of a former Naval Academy football player on charges of sexually assaulting a female midshipman was delayed on Monday because of a snowstorm that shut down the U.S. capital....

docs.snippet: Billionaire James Irsay, the 54-year-old owner of the National Football League's Indianapolis Colts, was jailed early on Monday on suspicion of driving while intoxicated and possession of a controlled substance, authorities said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Billionaire James Irsay, the 54-year-old owner of the National Football League's Indianapolis Colts, was jailed early on Monday on suspicion of driving while intoxicated and possession of a controlled substance, authorities said.

headline.main: Owner of NFL's Indianapolis Colts Accused of Intoxicated Driving
headline.print_headline: Owner of NFL's Indianapolis Colts Accused of Intoxicated Driving

docs.snippet: Didier Drogba will have to fight hard to control his emotions when he returns to Stamford Bridge for Galatasaray's Champions League last-16 second leg against Chelsea, the Ivorian said on the eve of Tuesday's match....
docs.lead_paragraph: Didier Drogba will have to fight hard to control his emotions when he returns to Stamford Bridge for Galatasaray's Champions League last-16 second leg against Chelsea, the Ivorian said on the eve of Tuesday's match.

headline.main: I Must Control Emotions on Stamford Bridge Return: Drogba
